course_name: PROCUREMENT E-LEARNING PATHWAY: TENDERS AND QUOTATIONS
overview: As a Singapore Public Officer, you need to have a good understanding of the Government Procurement policy framework and its operating principles and rules. You also need to clearly understand and be able to apply the good practices in the Ministry of Finance's Instruction Manual (IM) on Procurement.This is a complete E-Learning package with the same content as the CSC classroom training programme “Managing the Procurement Function for Procurement Officers: Module 1 – Government Procurement Basics”. Through interactive game-based scenarios, you will learn and be engaged with rich multimedia, animations and quizzes.This learning pathway includes 14 modules.LEARNING OUTCOMESBy the end of this E-Learning pathway, you will be able to:Develop a clear mindset and understanding of the key principles of procurementApply the key IM requirements and guidelines under the 8 stages of the Procurement LifecycleUnderstand the key activities that need to be performed under the various procurement approaches.
whoshouldattend: You either manage projects which involve the use of Quotations and Tenders or you are a Procurement Officer.This programme is open to Singapore Public Officers only.

course_name: Investigative Interview Techniques
overview: As an investigation officer, you use interviews extensively to establish the facts of the case or complaint you are looking into. A good interview will have a positive impact on the outcome of your investigation. However, if you do not have the right interview skills, or apply the wrong interview techniques, not only would the interview results be rendered useless, it could also cause serious negative consequences for your organisation. Therefore, it is important for you to acquire the knowledge and skills needed to conduct interviews, and learn how to apply them.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Master the various techniques for interviewing through an experimental approachAppreciate the legal issues involved in various techniques of interviewingIdentify the common signs of deception by interviewees
whoshouldattend: You are an Enforcement Officer who conducts investigations within your jurisdiction, or a public officer who is involved investigative work.This programme is open to Singapore Public Officers only.

course_name: Facilitation Skills for OD Practitioners
overview: As an Organisation Development (OD) practitioner, you are frequently required to facilitate focus group discussions, corporate planning sessions and action planning workshops. Very often, the quality of the discussion during such sessions is dependent on the quality of facilitation. Investing in our ability to facilitate well can therefore reap significant dividends.  How can you improve your ability to facilitate? What core skills do you need to be an effective facilitator? What tools and techniques can you employ to facilitate small and large group discussions? What principles or considerations should you bear in mind when designing facilitated sessions?  This two-day programme will provide answers to these questions. It also offers you an opportunity for hands-on practice with feedback provided to help you hone your skill as a facilitator.  Objectives:By the end of the programme, you will:Learn tools and techniques to conduct small group and large group facilitationAcquire core skills needed for facilitation such as questioning techniques, listening skills and scribingLearn how to deliver facilitated sessions such as meetings, focus group discussions and action planning workshopsDevelop general awareness on design considerations for facilitated sessions such as corporate planning sessions and visioning exercises
whoshouldattend: You are an OD Practitioner who has to facilitate sessions such as focus group discussions, action planning workshops, corporate planning sessions.This programme is open to Singapore Public Officers only.

overview: Your writing reflects your professionalism and your organisation’s credibility. course_name: Every Door is the Right Door (NWD Simulation Workshop)
overview: Members of the public generally view the Public Service as a single entity. Since its inception in 2004, the No Wrong Door policy has been largely successful in helping our public officers deal with misdirected feedback or cross-agency issues brought up by the public. But what happens when the issues are not so straightforward? Or there seems to be "no right door"?This workshop is designed to help public officers in frontline teams better understand and operationalise the No Wrong Door (NWD) policy and its recent enhancement, the First Responder Protocol (FRP).The workshop will have a mix of frontline officers and supervisors from different agencies attending it together to learn about the NWD/FRP steps and accompanying skill sets through case simulations in a classroom setting. Going beyond just a "tell" session, this workshop simulates real-life challenges and dilemmas that frontline officers and their supervisors face in the course of their daily work when handling customer.OBJECTIVESBy the end of the workshop, you will be able to:•Provide inter-agency customer service according to the procedures and standards specified in the NWD policy and the FRP•Display a WOG attitude and the First Responder spirit when responding to customer requests that involve multiple agencies•Demonstrate customer service skills and people skills in email, face-to-face and phone interactions with customers and colleagues from other agencies when responding to inter-agency customer requests
opento: Support Officer; Senior Officer; Manager; Middle Management
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer whose work involves inter-agency coordination as you deliver service to the public.

course_name: Communicating towards Effective Relationships through Transactional Analysis
overview: A theory of communication applicable to a range of personal, professional and social contexts, Transactional Analysis (TA) provides a systematic approach to understanding the links between human needs and behaviours. It will also make you effective in solving problems your organisation faces and in serving your customers. In this programme, you will undergo psychological profiling to understand your own communication style, thus increasing your effectiveness in communicating with the people around you.  Certification:You will receive a TA101 Certificate – equivalent to a US introductory university course - issued by the Training and Certification Council of Transactional Analysts, Inc. [ITAA (US), WPATA (Aust), ITA (UK), EATA (Europe)]. This certificate will be useful if you wish to obtain further academic qualifications in this field. 90% attendance is necessary for you to be given the certificate.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Interact more effectively with your customers, peers, subordinates, superiors and significant otherCreate win-win relationshipsSeek solutions to service and people problems

course_name: Emotional Intelligence - The Key to Leading Performance
overview: It is a myth that only smart and hardworking people can be successful. While intelligence is important to success, it is by no means the be-all and end-all to success. A growing body of research suggests that emotional intelligence, measured by emotional quotient (EQ), is a better predictor of “success” than the more traditional measures of cognitive intelligence (IQ). Emotional Intelligence is not about being soft, emotional and "nice". Rather, it is about being effective, and knowing how to communicate and work effectively. Emotional Intelligence reflects one's ability to deal with daily challenges and it also includes internal skills necessary to manage and control oneself in different situations.Utilising BarOn EQ-I, a globally leading EQ assessment tool, you will discover your EQ level and see first-hand how important it is. Using the EQ framework, you will also learn to evaluate strategies for talent management, organisational performance and individual development.Special FeaturesEQ assessments will be done online prior to the workshop. Your individual EQ score and development report will be given to you during the course to help you learn more about your EQ profiles.The Bar On EQ-i is the globally leading tool for assessing Emotional Intelligence. It has been used by over 100,000 people throughout the world. The test is based on over 20 years of research and has been independently validated by numerous research studies at leading Universities. The tool is used by many major companies and government organisations around the world including IBM, American Express, and the Canadian and US Governments.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Understand the importance of Emotional Intelligence (EQ) inorganisationsKnow your own EQ profile using a leading EQ assessment tool, available only to certified usersCreate a personal EQ development strategy based on your own EQ profile
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who wish to apply EQ for better working relationships with your colleagues and stakeholders.

overview: Does promising public recognition boost charity giving?Does adopting a different teaching approach to a subject improve learning?Does giving higher subsidies increase take-up rates?How do policymakers find out what works and what does not?Randomised Controlled Trials (RCTs) can help you answer these questions and more. Regarded as one of the simplest yet most powerful tools in evidence-based research, RCTs have long been the preferred choice for research design in healthcare. And now, RCTs have been increasingly recognised to play an essential role in the rigorous design and evaluation of public policies. In this workshop, you will learn about the role of RCTs and how they can enhance the policymaking process. Through case studies and hands-on exercises, you will also learn the technical aspects, common obstacles and trade-offs policymakers might face in conducting RCTs.Learning Outcomes:Apply RCTs in the policymaking processDesign RCTs to test new interventions relevant to your area of workWork with a team to conduct RCTsRecognise the trade-offs and common obstacles in conducting RCTs
course_name: Workshop on Randomised Controlled Trials in Public Policy

course_name: Managing Staff Performance Using the AIM Model for Senior Officers who are Supervisors
overview: Performance Management has been identified as an important skill by the Public Service Division for supervisors in the Civil Service. As a new supervisor in the Civil Service, you are required to attend a comprehensive performance management course within one year of assuming your supervisory role. With the launch of the AIM Model appraisal framework in 2008, supervisors will be assessing the performance and potentials of their officers by based on the 7 qualities and 42 behaviours indicators.  You will learn how to appraise your staff using the AIM Model, as well as how to manage their performance through the different phases of the performance management cycle.  The new blended course consists of two parts:- Part I: 1.5-hour e-learning course- Part II: 2-day classroom course  The compulsory e-Learning course incorporates the AIM Model to help you understand the performance management philosophy, principles and system in the Civil Service. The sessions and activities in the classroom course will complement the content provided by the e-learning course and enables participants to apply and practise skills on performance management.  Objectives  By the end of this course, you will be able to:Explain the rationale, philosophy and principles of the performance management system in the Civil ServiceAppreciate performance management through the lenses of People, Policies and ProcessesAcquire a consistent conceptual frame of reference in the AIM Model appraisal and effectively manage the performance and potential of your officersApply the four phases in the performance management cycle to motivate and improve performanceDevelop the capabilities and enlarge the capacities of your supervisees
whoshouldattend: You are a new middle manager who has to appraise your staff using the AIM model. The programme is especially relevant for you if you are a Singapore Public Officer who is new to your managerial role within the Public Service, or if you are unfamiliar to the AIM model.This programme is open to Singapore Public Officers only.

overview: Created to take you through the fundamentals of design thinking, this 2-day intensive programme offers you the opportunity to get hands on and actively ‘do design’. You will also learn and appreciate how design methods can be applied to public sector challenges using the ThinkPlace Design System<sup>TM</sup>.The programme is designed in the form of a design charrette – an intensive workshop where various stakeholders and experts gather to address difficult issues in a short period of time through creative ideas. A charrette empowers everyone involved to be engaged in complex situations that call for new ways of looking at things. It also creates a powerful relationship between people.If you are new to the design process, this programme is a compelling way for you to experience applying the process of design to a real problem.ObjectivesUnderstand the design thinking process, particularly how it is applied in the public sectorGain practical insights and tools to help you experience the following aspects:The importance of empathy and understanding people’s needs in public sector challengesChallenge long-held assumptions and to see your role from different perspectives, including that of stakeholders and citizensAppreciate the value of ‘learning-by-doing’ as a way to turn abstract ideas into tangible solutions for user-tests early in the development process

overview: What do you need to successfully lead yourself, your teams and your organisation, while managing uncertainty and change?As a leader, the best asset you have is yourself. The more aware you are about your selfhood, including your mental models, gifts, limitations, shadows, values, purpose and beliefs, the more you are able to make intentional choices that better serve your people and organisation.Without strong self-awareness, you may run into the danger of manipulating and controlling others to prove your value. However, with a healthy sense of selfhood, you will serve from a place of acceptance, rather than to gain acceptance, thus better serving your organisation and the people you lead.At the end of the programme, you will be able to:Understand the importance and relevance of investing in inner work (self-leadership) to be more effective in your outer work as a leader.Better appreciate key aspects of your inner landscape, in particular:Your default self narratives in reaction to external situations and how they are impacting your actions, behaviours and the outcomesYour personal values and how these drive your decisions and choices.Leadership "shadows" might be limiting your growth and development.Build your capacity for self-awareness and self-knowledge through reflection, journaling, solitude and searching coversations.

course_name: Mastering Telephone and Email Service Skills
overview: Do you want to stand out the moment you pick up the phone and be the shining voice of your organisation? Do you want to be equipped with a set of comprehensive yet easy to use tool and guide to handle every telephone contact situation?If the answer is "Yes" to the above, this course is designed with you in mind. You will see how to become positive and professional on the phone.Even though you are communicating with your customers through the telephone, your attitude can be evaluated through your verbal and vocal aspects in telephone communication. In the eyes of your customers, you represent your organisation and not justin the capacity of a "Customer Service Representative".We will show you how to view each call as unique and how to make every customer contact a success. We will also show you how one poorly handled call can create extra work and customer dissatisfaction.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to: <ul type="disc">Recall Singapore Public Service’s CARE + 3 Service PrinciplesArticulate the competencies needed to do your job competently and professionallyApply the techniques learned to manage attitude and to stay positive and respond calmly in stressful situationsKnow how to create positive “moments of truth” in customer engagementUse the right vocal and cooperative verbal communication to handle customers professionallyAble to use empathetic listening and questioning skills to manage customers’ emotionApply the LA<sup>2</sup>S<sup>2</sup>T guidelines to diffuse angry/irate customer situationsUse the techniques and guidelines shared to deal with three common types of customers and difficult customer situations on the phoneDemonstrate professionalism by applying the telephone etiquette in your interaction with customersApply the right format and simple tips shared in writing emailServe with firmness during difficult service encounters
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who supports a team and is a call center representative, personal assistant, telephone operator, or wish to master essential telephone techniques.

course_name: Becoming The CEO Of My Work And Life
overview: Growing responsibilities and workload can take a toll on your family life, just as heading into different life stages can have an impact on your work life. Take control of your work and life and achieve a more effective work-life balance. Doing so would help you concentrate better at work, maintain a high level of motivation and stay productive. Learn the skills that will empower you to achieve better work-life harmony.  ObjectivesThis course seeks to help you understand your Work Styles Profile™, stress triggers and make adjustments to your lives in order to experience the sense of achievement and satisfaction to become the CEO of your work and life.  By the end of this course, you will be able to: Review and redefine what work-life balance isUnderstand your own personality and work style – Flexstyles©Examine personal triggers that cause the greatest stress (at work)Make small changes to lower stress and increase work-life harmonyNegotiate a new Flexstyles© - to achieve work-life harmony
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who wants to take control of your work and life to gain better work-life harmony.

course_name: Organisational Savvy: Strategies for Gaining Influence
overview: As a manager, you may find yourself navigating through organisational politics regularly to gain the influence and power needed to achieve desired results. Often, you will have to work with and through your officers, peers and stakeholders to realise mutually beneficial outcomes for you, your team and your organisation.Learn how you can increase your level of influence to help yourself and your team in this programme. You will also find out what you should take note of when working with colleagues.By the end of the programme, you will be able to:Understand the key features of organisational politics and what it means to be organisational savvyGain an overview of the different political styles that people use to gain influenceIdentify the different sources of power that people can tap on to gain influenceLearn strategies to better gain influence that will benefit yourself, your officer(s) and your organization
whoshouldattend: You are a first line manager who oversees individual contributors or a team of individual contributors. You would like to better lead your officer(s) to achieve organisational goals by learning how to better gain influence.

course_name: Strategic Leadership: Strategies for Increasing Performance
overview: An effective leader is able to adopt different leadership styles in different situations. Increase your ability and effectiveness as a leader by being able to adapt and deploy appropriate strategic approaches to leadership challenges and opportunities through this programme.In this programme, you will learn about a proven Strategic Leadership Model that will help you to motivate and influence your team to higher levels of productivity. You will also become more aware of your leadership habits and preferences, and be able to examine how successful your usual approaches are. Explore what other possible leadership strategies you can use to help you better manage individuals, workgroups and teams in this workshop.This is a highly interactive and stimulating programme that uses a variety of activities and tools, such as a diagnostic instrument, videos, case studies, table group discussions and a competitive team exercise, to provide you with a holistic and enriching learning experience.ObjectivesBy the end of this three-day programme, you will:Be able to confidently apply the Strategic Leadership ModelLearn a practical three-step method for selecting a leadership strategy that will improve performance and develop your “Follower’s” capacityBe more aware of your leadership patternsBe better able to self-manage and develop leadership behaviours and practicesBuild a repertoire of potential leadership actions to apply to individuals, workgroups and teamsGain new tools, techniques and insights that help you to add value as a leader at your workplace
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who oversees individual contributors/a team of individual contributors/managers/multiple teams. You are interested to learn how to apply situational leadership to lead more effectively.

course_name: The Politics of Policy Making
overview: The role of the public officer is often thought to be distinct from the political process. Policymakers advise and elected political leaders decide. However, for public officers to know how best to advise, we need to understand the political considerations of our leaders. The ability to grasp political considerations and factor them into the design of policies often determines whether the policy can be successfully formulated and executed.    You will explore the intersection between politics and the public service in relation to policymaking and implementation. The goal is to help you understand the political context against which public administration is conducted.  This will help you carry out your work in a way which meets the desired objectives and addresses political concerns.  Objectives   By the end of the course, you will be able to: Understand the political process, its impact on policy formulation and implementation, and the role of the public officer   Understand the political considerations of leaders, and be more alert to policy situations which are likely to be politically sensitive   Design and implement policies in ways which address political considerations and achieve the desired objectives
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Service Officer or Manager with policy writing responsibilities, or want to find out more about the contexts of policy making.

course_name: Writing Effective Minutes of Meetings for Senior Officers
overview: A good minute-taker is one who possesses a variety of skills. These include being able to summarise and listen effectively during a meeting; writing clearly, concisely and tactfully when translating notes into a set of minutes. As a minute taker, you have an important role in ensuring that organisational facts, issues, follow-up actions and decisions made at meetings are properly documented and recorded accurately and clearly.  Learn what it takes to perform secretariat duties associated with minute-taking effectively and efficiently, at this intensive hands-on programme.   ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Perform the secretariat duties associated with a Minute TakerPrepare an agenda to guide meetingsListen to discussions objectivelyExtract relevant information from discussions and minute them accuratelyUse appropriate language to summarise the discussion and decisions made during the meetingPresent minutes in a clear and concise manner
whoshouldattend: You are a a Singapore Public Officer whose work requires you to take minutes of meetings.

overview: Ever feel “stuck” when conversing with your stakeholders, and wonder why you can’t seem to see each other’s perspective? How do you sense-make and also be empathetic when engaging stakeholders?As a public officer, increasing citizen participation in social issues and public policies means that you need to listen with empathy and have clarifying conversations to navigate complexity. The ability to hold empathetic conversations is thus essential, and how you listen depends on your emotional capacity and narratives.Developed in partnership with The Thought Collective, Sense-make and Empathy Through Powerful Conversations is a two-part experience. In the first part, you will develop personal awareness and learn to facilitate new possibilities in the domains of body, language, and emotion. In the second part, you will apply what you learnt to facilitate powerful conversations and design meaningful innovation.Learning Outcomes:Examine how you show up as a public officer and identify your conversational habits in work and lifeDistinguish the narratives that different emotions reveal, as well as common speech acts in conversationExercise and strengthen your capacity for empathyPractise and improve your ability to engage stakeholders through raising the quality of conversationsApply narrative and emotional frameworks to have powerful conversations at work

course_name: Workshop on Emotional Intelligence for Support Officers
overview: Having a high IQ does not automatically guarantee success. Other "intelligent" factors such as self-awareness, impulse control, persistence, self-motivation and empathy are qualities which mark people who excel in life. These basic qualities are now commonly known as "Emotional Intelligence (EQ)".People with high EQ enjoy fulfilling relationships with others while those who lack EQ may suffer from poor health due to depression, eating disorders and other aggressive behaviours, which will have a negative impact on work performance.You will learn how you can improve your relationships with others by developing your intrapersonal and interpersonal skills at this two-day workshop.ObjectivesBy the end of this workshop, you will be able to:Ask the right questions to get the right answersImprove interactions with othersInfluence one's actions resulting in better interpersonal interactionIncrease understanding of work motivation and job satisfaction
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who wishes to apply Emotional Intelligence to better support your team or department.

course_name: Procurement for Approving Authorities
overview: “Based on the audits for this year and the last six years, AGO observed that procurement has continued to be an area prone to lapses. While efforts had been made to enhance procurement rules and procedures across the public sector over the last few years, there were indications that some entities were not sufficiently diligent in ensuring compliance with procurement rules in the areas that AGO audited.”Report of the Auditor-General for the FY 2012/13“An approving authority is a gatekeeper responsible for ensuring that the principles of open and fair competition, transparency and value for money are upheld…and in doing so, should exercise a measure of scepticism in its scrutiny.”Report of the Auditor-General for the FY 2011/12This course aims to help you gain an appreciation of the procurement framework in the Singapore Public Service and better understand your role and responsibility as Approving Officers (AOs) in procurement management.Conducted through the use of a series of case studies, scenarios and audit reports, questions being addressed will include the following:How has the recent slate of high profile procurement cases changed the public procurement landscape in Singapore?What is the role of an approving authority in ensuring due diligence in procurement?What are some of the common procurement pitfalls and mistakes that approving authorities should be looking out for?By the end of this course, you should be able to:Describe the changes in the public procurement landscape in Singapore due to the recent slate of high profile procurement casesExplain the procurement framework in the Singapore Public ServiceDescribe the roles and responsibilities of different approving authorities in ensuring due to diligence in procurementDetect common pitfalls and mistakes in procurement as an approving authority
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who acts as an Approving Authority in the procurement process.

course_name: Designing Integrated Marketing Communication Campaigns for Public Sector (Foundation)
overview: In an age dominated by information and all things digital, we need marketing campaigns that are integrated, adaptable and compelling. A video, a media release, a social media post or an event is no longer enough for a campaign to succeed these days. Instead, we need to develop campaigns that are strategic, timely and able to compellingly engage our audiences across multiple platforms.  In this two-day programme, you will learn a framework that can be used to develop a cohesive marketing campaign. You will also learn the nuts and bolts of developing marketing campaigns for the public sector - from understanding the communication brief to designing strategy, content, tactics, timelines and budgets.  By the end of the programme, you will be able to:Understand the principles of campaign planning and apply them to develop a marketing communication campaignAppreciate the use of different marketing communication platformsDevelop content strategies for different audiences and channelsUnderstand how to implement and evaluate the campaign
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore public officer government communicator involved in developing and implementing marketing communication campaigns, with 1-3 years of experience in the public service. You want to build your foundational competencies and skill set.

course_name: The Leader's Role in Facilitating Effective Team Meetings
overview: As a leader, how can we guide our team through effective decision-making processes that result in quality decisions? How can we facilitate strong buy-in and commitment for decisions made?Important decisions and critical work are usually made and set in motion during meetings. Whether they are big or small, a well-structured and purposeful meeting deliver quality decisions that enjoy strong buy-in from its members. Yet, many of the meetings we attend do not deliver such results. In-fact, facilitating such decision-making processes has become one of the biggest challenges managers face today.Find out how you can facilitate effective processes that will help your team make high quality decisions that they believe in and are committed to. This programme will provide you with the framework and skills to do so.ObjectivesBy the end of this programme, you will be able to:Facilitate meetings that achieve the followingProvide forums where opinions can be safely sharedHigh levels of engagement are createdQuality decisions get made in the context of shared information and appropriate analysisDesign a meeting structure that supports groups and avoids unnecessary tension, silent stand -offs and frustrating circular discussionGuide meetings toward clear outcomes and unambiguous action plans that lead to continued momentum after the meetingManage problematic meeting behaviour to prevent strong personalities from taking over, or shy participants from retreating into resentful silence
whoshouldattend: You are a middle manager overseeing one or more teams. You would like to conduct effective meetings that facilitate ownership of issues and optimal decisions for your team(s).

course_name: Business Intelligence and Dashboarding
overview: Business Intelligence (BI) is a tool-driven process to analyse data, generate insights and present these insights for more informed decision-making. A dashboard is a visual tool for presenting multiple data analyses on a common interface for quick insights. When you combine Business Intelligence and dashboarding, what you get is a tool that not only gives a quick snapshot of important metrics and analyses, but also enables end-users to interact with the data and derive meaningful and actionable insights.In this workshop, you will learn how to use Business Intelligence tools to analyse trends, spot key issues and derive data-driven insights.ObjectivesIntegrate and analyse multiple datasets using Power PivotDesign and create effective and interactive dashboardsExplore data and derive visual insights using Power ViewCommunicate insights to decision-makers in a coherent and convincing manner
opento: Senior Officer; Manager; Middle Management; Senior Management
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer interested in learning how to use business intelligence tools to analyse trends, spot key issues and deliver data-driven insights. course_name: Plan NOW for Your Retirement and Re-Employment for Support Officers
overview: In 2004, the Committee on Ageing Issues (CAI) was formed with a vision of achieving ‘Successful Ageing for Singapore’, i.e. to ensure that all levels of society – the individual, the family, the community and the nation – are well prepared for the challenges and opportunities of an ageing Singapore. The CAI wants to empower individuals to age with dignity and security as integral members of society living in a vibrant and socially cohesive nation. You need to make many decisions in both financial and non-financial areas before retirement. This programme will help you prepare to optimise your well-being in the next phase of your life. You will gain a good understanding of what retirement means in the current context of Singapore and be well prepared physically, psychologically and financially to live an active and meaningful life in your old age.ObjectivesBy the end of the course, you will be able to:Manage intellectual, emotional and physical changesPrepare for new roles in the social and family networkManage your health and well-beingUnderstand financial planning issues in retirementDiscover other options for work during retirement yearsUnderstand how to start a small business as an option after retirement
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who would like to prepare for your retirement. At your workplace, you usually support your team or department.

course_name: Developing Dynamic Governance Capabilities
overview: “No amount of careful planning can assure a government of continual relevance and effectiveness if there is insufficient institutional capacity for learning, innovation and change in the face of ever new challenges in a volatile and unpredictable global environment” - Professor Neo Boon Siong in Dynamic Governance: Embedding Culture, Capabilities and Change in Singapore (2007)  Join Professor Neo Boon Siong as he explains how government can create and sustain institutional dynamism in the midst of uncertainty and rapid changes.  Building on his book - Dynamic Governance, Professor Neo will help you understand and apply the framework of “Thinking ahead”, “Thinking again” and “Thinking across” to institutionalise desired culture, capabilities and changes in your organisation.
whoshouldattend: You lead a team of officers in your agency. Singapore Public Officers in charge of Organisational Development or Strategic Planning in your agency will also find this programme useful.

course_name: Seven Habits Of Highly Effective People For Support Officers
overview: Habits, defined as the intersection of knowledge, skill and desire, are powerful factors in our lives. They constantly express our characters and influence the degree of effectiveness in our personal and work life. It is crucial that we consciously cultivate in ourselves habits that lead to excellence.  Learn how the Seven Habits of Highly Effective People can enhance effectiveness in your work and personal life.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to establish a mental framework to:Make things happen and increase efficiencyIdentify what matters most in their work and personal livesPrioritize and achieve their most important goals, instead of constantly reacting to urgenciesCollaborate more effectively by building relationships of trust and mutual benefitEffectively communicate in all aspects of their lives, including the digital worldApproach problems and opportunities with creative collaborationIntegrate continuous improvement and learning
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer is interested in developing your personal and interpersonal effectiveness to better support your team and department

course_name: Data Visualisation for Effective Communications
overview: Data has always been available, but manipulating it to derive useful insights was once the exclusive domain of data scientists and ‘number crunchers’. However, with the increase in the volumes of data and the availability of suitable tools, this is no longer the case. The growth of the analytics industry and its widespread application in all fields has made data the star, and the people who can wield its power, rock stars.Data has the power to influence and bring about meaningful change, but to bring about this change, it is not enough to just explain your analysis and support it with data - you need to tell a meaningful story that resonates with your audience. This is where visualisation plays a big role. Today, data visualisation is one of the most exciting fields of study.In this programme, you will learn to appreciate the power of visualising statistics and how to craft more meaningful visualisations to communicate your message more effectively. You will also be introduced to other visualisation tools in the market.Learning Outcomes:Explain the importance of visualising statistics and their role in effective communicationApply the principles of data visualisation to charts and graphsAssess the type of chart which communicates your data most effectivelyUse Tableau to tell visual stories using different types of charts, graphs and interactive dashboards
whoshouldattend: You are an Singapore Public officer who is responsible for producing or communicating statistics to your stakeholders.

overview: Supervising is an important yet challenging responsibility. course_name: Customer Research through Surveys and Analytics
overview: A successful organisation, be it in the private sector or the Public Service, listens to the needs of their customers. Almost all organisations conduct some form of customer surveys which is essential to understand and retain customers.However, problems arise when organisations neither establish clear survey objectives nor possess skills in conducting surveys, such as:Determining what information to collectExtracting necessary and useful information from the data collectedApplying appropriate metrics to interpret survey data in a meaningful wayYou will learn skills to obtain the right information. You will also learn to extract, analyse and interpret useful and necessary information for decision-making. You will be better empowered to assist your agency to implement customer-focused improvements for service excellence.Learning Outcomes:Define customer survey objectives and determine survey outcomesIdentify the challenges faced when undertaking customer research projectsDevelop quality questionnaires and customer feedback toolsDiscuss how survey data may be analysed and interpretedUnderstand how survey data may be analysed and interpretedUse appropriate measures to ensure accuracy in data collectionAssess if an organisation is using meaningful metrics to analyse data
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who is involved in customer research.

course_name: Plan NOW for Your Retirement and Re-Employment for Senior Officers
overview: In 2004, the Committee on Ageing Issues (CAI) was formed with a vision of achieving ‘Successful Ageing for Singapore’, i.e., to ensure that all levels of society – the individual, the family, the community and the nation – are well prepared for the challenges and opportunities of an ageing Singapore. The CAI wants to empower individuals to age with dignity and security as integral members of society living in a vibrant and socially-cohesive nation. You need to make many decisions in both financial and non-financial areas before retirement. This programme will help you prepare to optimise your well-being in the next phase of your life. You will gain a good understanding of what retirement means in the current context of Singapore and be well prepared physically, psychologically and financially to live an active and meaningful life in your old age. ObjectivesBy the end of the course, you will be able to:Manage intellectual, emotional and physical changesPrepare for new roles in the social and family networkManage your health and well-beingUnderstand financial planning issues in retirementDiscover other options for work during retirement yearsUnderstand how to start a small business as an option after retirement
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who wants to prepare for your retirement.

course_name: Cross-Cultural Understanding of China
overview: China's increasing economic and political prominence has created a new focus in Singapore's foreign relations. As collaborations and diplomatic exchanges between Singapore and China deepen, you may be involved in China-related projects, either venturing into the Chinese territories or hosting Chinese delegates. To interact effectively with the Chinese goes beyond being bilingual. Having a good understanding of China - its history, its culture, and most importantly, its people and the way they think and behave - will enable you to be more confident and effective in your interactions with them.This interactive workshop not only covers essential knowledge about China and the Chinese, but also provides ample opportunities for exchange and learning among course participants. You will also be able to hear sharing of experiences by an agency which has extensive dealings with China.Learning Outcomes:Summarize and describe the history, culture and values of China and the factors that have affected China's foreign policy today.Explain how domestic and external factors might influence China's foreign policy decision making, and illustrate with examples.Identify and articulate the issues that have impacted Singapore's bilateral relationship with China.Gain insights into China's business climate and describe how foreign businesses operate in China.Learn and demonstrate how to interact effectively with Chinese government officials and business executives
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer involved in international relations work, particularly with China. This programme is especially relevant for officers who need to interact with the Chinese for work or social purposes.

course_name: Public Project Leadership Programme (14-21 Aug 2018)
overview: As public project leader undertaking building and infrastructure development projects, how do you set a clear vision and sustainable objectives while contending with challenging fiscal and manpower constraints?This 5.5-day Public Project Leadership Programme (PPLP) will enhance your project leadership skills and equip you to effectively plan, manage and implement large-scale public projects. You will also have the opportunity to experience the challenges in managing stakeholders through a simulation and interact with project leaders in the Public Service.This leadership programme is jointly organised by the Centre for Public Project Management (Ministry of Finance) and the Civil Service College.Learning Outcomes:Build essential leadership skills in project managementGain a strategic and visionary perspective to make value-based, innovative decisions through a helicopter, multi-perspective view to connect the dotsDevelop a people-centric mindset to continuously engage internal (team members and intra-agency colleagues) and external (citizens and community) stakeholdersDeepen and widen your critical knowledge to consider different areas such as stakeholders, technical and operational requirements, contract and financial management
whoshouldattend: You are a prospective or current project leader* in the Public Service and are involved in building and infrastructure development projects.*Project leaders typically have at least 10 years of professional or public service work experience and are Deputy Directors or above.

course_name: Effective Budgeting Skills
overview: You will obtain insights into S.T.R.A.T.E.G.I.C budgeting, with each letter reminding you of a core budgeting principle in the public sector. Because budgeting is at the core of control and coordination of resources, it is fundamental to the strategic outcome of any organisation. Moreover, budgeting in the public sector has moved towards a more performance-informed budgeting system, which is not just a simple allocation of funds but an exercise where strategic interests are considered and budgeting principles adhered to. You will learn how to put budgeting principles into practice. whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who is interested in finding out more about the principles of good budgeting in the public sector.

course_name: EQ In Customer Service For Frontline Staff
overview: Emotional Intelligence (EQ) is an important tool in today’s challenging and demanding customer service environment, especially if you encounter many emotionally-charged interactions, be it with internal or external customers.  EQ includes a set of learnable skills involving self-awareness, empathy, optimism, self-direction and motivation to manage customers and inter-personal relationships. Through this course, you will learn about the Six Seconds EQ Model and you will extend your EQ to manage and excel in customer service. You will also obtain new insights into successful people and relationships when learning about EQ and how to translate this knowledge to harness your strengths.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Have greater self-awareness of your emotions and handle them better when dealing with customersExercise consequential thinking while handling difficult customersEngage intrinsic motivation and exercise optimism so as to enjoy your relationship with customersIncrease your empathy and handle difficult customers more effectivelySet goals for an enjoyable journey in the customer service relationship
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer dealing with external customers.

overview: As OD practitioners, we often find ourselves playing a role in addressing organisational issues such as employee engagement and inter-department/intra-agency collaborations. To do so, there is a need to probe deeper and to collect and make sense of information to find out the possible root causes of issues we observe. Only then can we make the appropriate recommendations on the interventions and follow-up actions can be taken.This two-day programme will equip you with the basics on organisational diagnosis and address the following questions:How is organisational diagnosis useful and impactful?When do we conduct organisational diagnosis?What are the key tasks performed during diagnosis and what are some useful models that we can tap on?In addition, opportunities for practice and feedback given during the course will help you to hone your skills as an OD practitioner.

course_name: Managing Tension - A Core Leadership Skill
overview: As a manager, how can you better manage your tension to spur personal growth and build rapport with your team members? How does your leadership stance and personal values impact the way you manage this tension?Managers are expected to work with and through team members, peers and stakeholders to achieve results. When perspectives differ, tension is inevitable. How well you manage this tension will impact the quality of your relationships and how others experience you as a person. Tension is the signal that there are differences in the way something is being viewed. There are two typical ways of dealing with tension. The first is to see tension as wrong and try to take control and ‘make it right’. The other way is to try resolving this tension through dialogue or communication.Specially targeted at managers, this programme will help you find these answers.ObjectivesBy the end of this programme, you will be able to:Understand and appreciate tension as a source of learning and growthAcquire practical skills to manage your tension as part of your development at the personal and team levelsName and frame your tension in a more empowering wayBe more self-aware and switch to a learner stance when managing tensionUncover your own personal values and frame tension as dilemmasAdvocate, inquire and listen more deeply to discover more possibilities when dealing with tension
whoshouldattend: You are a middle manager who oversees one or more teams and would like to learn how to effectively manage your tension so that you can better lead your team(s).

course_name: Leading from Within: Reflections on Leadership for Middle Managers (ROL10)
overview: What do you need as a leader to lead yourself, your teams and your organisations in a sustainable manner in the world today?The best asset a leader has is not his skills, competencies, intelligence, or experiences - it is him as a person, and specifically his self-awareness.With a strong awareness of self, you will make more intentional choices leading to your desired results and be better placed to serve your people and organisation.Without a strong awareness of self, you run into the danger of reacting to the environment, your anxiety level rises and your energy depletes, unconsciously harming you and the people you work and live with.In this programme, learn the conditions needed for your best self to turn up in life and work. Learn what is needed for you as a leader to create conditions necessary for your team members' best selves to show up. It is time to stop sabotaging yourself and creating outcomes you do not want. It is time to learn what you can do to improve your self-awareness and attain your desired outcomes. Sign up now!Learning Outcomes:Increase your awareness of the importance and relevance of investing in inner work (self-leadership) to be more effective in your outer work as a leader.Enhance your consciousness of key aspects of your inner landscape, in particular: your default self-narratives in reaction to external situations and how they are impacting your actions, behaviours and outcomes. principles and practices of energy management for sustainable self-care. identifying and claiming your natural gifts. leadership "shadows" that might be limiting your growth and development.Experience the disciplines of reflection, journaling, solitude and searching conversations to build capacity for self-awareness and self-knowledge.
whoshouldattend: You are a Senior Assistant Director, Deputy Director (or equivalent level) who wants to reflect on how you might more effectively enhance your personal mastery to lead yourself, your teams and your organisation in the midst of uncertainty and change.You should not have attended SLEAD prior to FY18.This programme is for Singapore Public Officers.

course_name: Navigating a Complex World: Expanded Thinking and Being for Leaders
overview: How can we think more expansively, navigate complexity, and go beyond change to be more effective leaders?As we encounter greater complexity, change, diversity, and uncertainty, our thinking and tools need to be more open and dynamic, so we are less likely to get “In Over Our Heads”, what Harvard Professor Robert Kegan aptly named one of his books.In this participative, thought-provoking workshop, you will learn assessments, maps, models and tools that will aid your development as a human being and a leader. You will gain a broader set of strategies that will enable you to relate to change and complexity better, and rise above your challenges to achieve your work and life goals.
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer holding a position of Director, Deputy Director or equivalent. You intend to expand your range of thinking and behaviour, manage complexity more effectively, and gain practical insights on how to overcome your challenges.

overview: As a corporate communications officer, you have to keep a close and constant watch on current affairs to sieve out events which may have implications for your organisation. course_name: Futurecraft 201: Scenario Planning Workshop
overview: In the words of Singapore’s former Head of Civil Service, Lim Siong Guan, “Scenario planning was a wonderful opportunity for the civil service to think long term about the kind of Singapore they wanted to build.” Scenarios show what about the future we cannot change, and what we can change. That is the value of scenarios: sketching for us the terrain within which we have room to manoeuvre.Scenarios are a complement to quantitative models to forecast the future, because they analyse qualitative factors that drive change, such as shifts in values and interests, which are not easily captured by quantitative models. Scenarios can spark “strategic conversations” on possible futures, and allow the discussion of questions that may be otherwise uncomfortable to discuss.This two-day course is intended for agencies planning to undertake a full-scale scenario project. You will be taught the full methodology of scenario planning.Learning Outcomes:Define the local question;Identify and analyse driving forces;Construct scenario frameworksArticulate and communicate the scenario stories; andTranslate scenarios to strategies.This workshop provides a much more in-depth and hands-on experience of scenario planning than FutureCraft 101, though this course builds upon the basics taught in that course. You are encouraged to attend FutureCraft 101 before attending FutureCraft 201.
opento: Senior Officer; Manager; Middle Management; Senior Management
whoshouldattend: You are an experienced Singapore Public Officer who has strategic planning responsibilities and/or will carry out scenario planning in the near future.

course_name: Vetting Sensitive Written Replies to Customers
overview: How can you avoid aggravating difficult situations in your written replies to customers? How do you ensure that your written replies are nuanced, empathetic and courteous so as to effectively manage public implications and safeguard your organisation's interests?In this programme, you will learn a framework, tools and skills to help you vet sensitive written replies to customers. overview: Faced with a rapidly changing environment and citizens' increasing expectations, Public Service organisations need to respond by being more effective in their performance. However, managers like you, with your multiple work responsibilities, may find it challenging to do so.This programme equips you with strategies, skills and tools to engage and retain your officers. course_name: Introduction To Contract Management
overview: As a Government Procurement (GP) officer, you are responsible to ensure that you achieve value-for-money (VFM) from your contracts. However, without effective contract management, you will not be able to fully achieve this from your procurement contracts, or worse, risk contract failures. Hence, the Ministry of Finance has made contract management a key stage under the Procurement Lifecycle in the Instruction Manual on Procurement.  In this programme, you will learn the processes involved in contract management as well as the specific terms and conditions used in these contracts. You will also get to study copies of actual contractual documents, take part in a training game and learn from case studies.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Explain the process of contract managementManage contracts using the tools and tips highlighted in the 4-stages of contract managementUncover issues in contracts by an in-depth understanding of the specific Terms and Conditions (T&Cs) used in typical government procurement contractsConduct contract management activities effectively according to the procurement policies and procedures of MOF’s Instruction Manual (IM)
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer directly involved in the various stages of the procurement lifecycle.

course_name: Introduction to Predictive Analytics – Tools and Techniques
overview: In this workshop, you will learn the fundamental principles of predictive analytics. Using popular tools such as Excel and RapidMiner, you will also learn which techniques ─ classification, regression, clustering or association analysis ─ to apply and when. You will understand how to resolve business problems using predictive analytics by going through the entire cycle of modelling and testing, and view demos of predictive analytics applications such as text analytics and anomaly detection. Finally, through an overview of big data terminologies and a reflection on ethical issues in predictive analytics, you will learn what to be prepared for in the future.Learning Outcomes:Describe what predictive analytics isApply predictive analytics methods using popular tools and techniquesAssess suitable opportunities within your agencies to apply predictive analytics
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore public officer who requires the use of data to improve performance and/or provide insights into decision making.

course_name: Strengthening Your Leadership Influence and Impact
overview: As a leader, you may know a great deal about leadership in theory. The cognitive and behavioural aspects of leadership are important, but to have the greatest impact, you need to discover your embodied presence. Every day, your courage, confidence, strength and compassion will all count, especially when handling high-pressure situations. To access these qualities, you have to look deep within yourself, beyond your cognitive memory. Only then will your integrity, authenticity and presence emanate, enabling you to exert your influence where it matters most.In this programme, you will learn practical approaches to deepen your presence and effectiveness as a leader, using mindfulness and somatic activities set within a theoretical framework and applied to your specific context. This will enable you to integrate less familiar aspects of your leadership power with the capabilities you already use. You will also gain clarity on what drives you and learn how to stay committed to that even under pressure, and explore ways in which you can better engage and inspire your team(s) to achieve your agency’s objectives.ObjectivesBy the end of this programme, you will be able to:Maintain your presence to lead effectively and gain trust and respect as a leaderAdapt your responses under pressure so as to respond with greater clarity and confidenceHold courageous conversations about important issuesEmbody authenticity, integrity, trust, consistency and confidence
whoshouldattend: You are a middle manager who oversees one or more teams in the Singapore Public Service. You would like to learn how to enhance your leadership influence and impact to better engage and inspire your team(s).

course_name: Crisis Communication
overview: Crisis management deals with the reality of a crisis, while crisis communications deal with the perception of that reality. Your biggest challenge in a crisis is reacting with the right response expediently. Your organisation may manage a crisis well but if you fail to communicate effectively with your stakeholders, you run the risk of adverse reputational issues.Through case studies and role-play, you will be able to:Anticipate your communication needs during a crisisPrepare a crisis communication planDevelop and deliver the right messagesDeal with the media during a crisisLearning Outcomes:Identify the key principles of crisis communicationDraft a crisis communication plan including key messagesExplain the steps to manage the traditional, digital and social media during a crisis
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who handles crisis communications for your agency.

course_name: Basic Systems Thinking
overview: Systems are all around us. Our workplaces, organisations, families, finances, policies and the economy are all examples of human systems. Thus, our success in life and work is very much dependent on how well we manage such systems. Unfortunately, many of us are unable to deal effectively with systems. Very often, our attempts at improving our lives and work simply end up making things worse.  Or, the system resists our best efforts and does not change at all.  Naturally, we end up feeling frustrated, puzzled and even helpless.The reason for this limited success in dealing with human systems lies in the difficulty in seeing the connections that exist among its various components (i.e. the stakeholders within the system).  When we fail to see such connections, our well-intentioned actions often create unintended consequences.  Systems Thinking, is a set of simple tools to help us see these connections better and create more effective strategies for both our lives and work. This requires us to answer The 3 Questions That Systems Thinkers Ask (or 3QueST™ for short).  In this programme, several tools, which are also part of the 3QueST™ methodology, are introduced to address these 3 questions.  There will be opportunities to practice using the tools on issues or challenges you are facing in your work or personal life.ObjectivesBy the end of the programme, you will be able to:Know the 3 questions that System Thinkers ask (3QueST™)Identify leverage within the system to get the results we wantCreate strategies that can be sustained over time, and grow the results we want by creating a Success LoopAnticipate and deal with unintended consequences using the TFD toolIdentify and deal with the causes of resistance using the MARS framework
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who is interested in understanding systems and how seeing the connections systemic components can lead to better results.

course_name: Fundamentals Of Public Communication
overview: With the vast changes in the socio-economic and educational profile of our citizens, communicating with your target audience has become even more of a challenge. The public now expects transparency and information on the major policies and programmes, especially those that have an impact on them.  You will learn the basic principles of public communications and covers the strategic communications in the public sector when communicating with members of the public, the media and other key stakeholders. We will explore how technology and digital media are changing the context and tools of government communications. You will also understand how messaging and responses should be framed and crafted to resonate with the public, while considering your organisation’s objectives and reputation, as well as Singapore’s broad national interests.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Apply the principles of government communications in the successful delivery of public policyDescribe the unique role and nature of communications in Singapore's public policyUse the Cycle of Communications Strategy (Plan-Execute-Evaluate) to communicate and engage the public Craft messages/replies/responses that gain acceptance from the publicLeverage appropriate technology/digital media to communicate messages to different types of stakeholders
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer handling your agency's corporate communications functions.

overview: Faced with a rapidly changing environment and growing citizen expectations, organisations in the Public Service are increasingly required to respond by implementing change initiatives which can range from the introduction of new work processes or systems to organisational transformation. While some of these initiatives have found success, there are likely many others that have not. This can be attributed to the lack of attention paid to securing acceptance of change by affected stakeholders.What can we do as OD practitioners to improve the effectiveness of the change initiatives? How should we structure the management of these initiatives for success? What systematic approaches can we adopt to manage the human side of change? What can we do to foster the acceptance of change by the affected stakeholders?Programme MethodologyThis 3 day programme is designed to be practice-oriented and includes a simulation experience that facilitates learning transfer. You should come with your team member(s) as an intact change team and bring with you a real change management project that you are currently working on. This will allow you to apply Prosci’s research based Change Management Methodology.The Prosci® change management methodology has been developed through research and extensive benchmarking of change management practices worldwide. The methodology involves three steps: preparing for change, managing change and reinforcing change – all of which are scalable and flexible components that you can tailor and apply to your specific organisational needs.ObjectivesBy the end of the programme, you will be able to:Build the business case for effective change management in your organisation.Develop a change management strategy and plan for your project.Apply the ADKAR™ Model in helping managers and supervisors effectively manage the people side of change.Apply Prosci’s® change management methodology, tools and templates to an actual project from your organisation.[Note: You will be certified in Prosci’s® Change Management Methodology and will also be able to lead your organisation through both incremental and radical changes.]
course_name: Applied Change Management: Prosci® Change Management Certification Programme

overview: In this programme, you will experience coaching demonstrations and practise coaching as part of a highly experiential workshop. Besides refreshing your understanding of the GROW model in coaching, you will learn and gain confidence in how to use a Solutions-focused Coaching model.Subsequently, you will be supported via a small group coaching supervision session where you can raise issues and discuss challenges relating to the application of your learning and development of coaching skills at work.At the end of this programme, you will be able to:Expand the range of coaching skills and tools you can draw upon to coach team membersAdopt a ‘coaching mindset’ and enhance your fundamental coaching skillsDevelop confidence and capability to apply your coaching skills in one-to-one and team contexts, including developmental and challenging conversationsDeepen your awareness of your personal styles and preferences as a coaching manager, in order to integrate coaching as part of your authentic leadership styleThis programme is jointly designed and delivered by the Institute of Leadership and Organisation Development, Civil Service College, and Roffey Park.Founded in 1946, Roffey Park is a management and leadership institute internationally recognised for its expertise and experience in providing high-impact personal development programmes that transform individuals and organisations – improving the well-being and performance of both. Roffey Park works across the world with an average of 100 organisations each year from the private, public and not-for-profit sectors. They have a faculty who are subject matter experts and who have also held senior management positions, a network of over 80 associates in Asia Pacific and Europe, a team of researchers and information professionals, and staff dedicated to supporting their programmes.

course_name: Win-Win Mindset @ Work
overview: When you have a win-win mindset, you will approach activities and relationships in the workplace in a positive manner and have a more productive and satisfying work-life. However, in order to inculcate such a mindset, you need to be able to manage the differences that exist among each another in order to bring about mutually beneficial outcomes to all involved. You can learn the necessary skills to bring about such a mindset.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Illustrate some examples of win-win mindset at workUse the Johari Window model to explain the benefits of self disclosureIdentify different types of people and how they communicateUse three approaches to relate with others for win-win in the workplaceApply the Ladder of Inference and empathetic listening concepts in win-win conversationsUse different techniques to handle conflicts and resolve problems collaboratively
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who wishes to develop a win-win mindset to better support your team or department

course_name: Negotiation Skills for Senior Officers
overview: Being able to negotiate is a skill that can be applied universally, in the business world, the Public Service, and even our personal lives. At work, we sometimes find that results may be more effectively achieved through persuasion, accommodation and agreement, rather than executive authority. Negotiation skills are thus necessary in the resolution of differences. Learn how you can prepare for and handle negotiations to produce win-win outcomes.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Prepare systematically for major negotiationsUnderstand the influence of individual personality on negotiating styleRecognise the constraints imposed by organisational cultureUse tactics to neutralise a power imbalanceLearn proven techniques of effective negotiators from international researchTrade concessions for greater long term valueCreate more options for win-win outcomesConfidently handle objections and difficultiesImplement a strategy for your most common negotiation scenariosPlay a co-ordinated role in major team negotiations
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer keen on developing your negotiation skills.

course_name: Basic Trial Advocacy Course
overview: To prepare prosecutors to conduct trials, CSC in collaboration with Attorney General’s Chambers is pleased to introduce the 3-day Basic Trial Advocacy Course.  This programme adopts the Hampel-method of Advocacy Training, and is specially designed for prosecutors who have recently started trial work, or who are ready to embark on trial litigation. The programme will include a Case Preparation / Case Analysis session, which promises to be interactive and dynamic. Trainees will also be given air-time for Examination-in-Chief and Cross-Examination, immediately after which the trainers will do a constructive review.  There will also be a session on Narrative Advocacy, to train participants to make written and oral submissions. The sessions will also be video-taped to facilitate video-review sessions.  Objectives:By the end of the course, you will have attained a minimum level of competence in:Case Preparation / Case AnalysisConducting Examination-in-Chief and Cross-Examination effectivelyPreparing for and presenting Oral Submissions and be acutely aware of his/her visual and audio personality in court.
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who has to conduct prosecutions on behalf of your agency.

course_name: Enhancing Interpersonal Relations, Influence and Impact through Emotional Intelligence (New!)
overview: The most effective leaders are all alike in one crucial way: they all have a high degree of what has come to be known as emotional intelligence. Without EQ, a person can have the best training in the world, an incisive, analytical mind, and an endless supply of smart ideas, but he still won’t make a great leader. (Daniel Goleman, “What Makes a Leader”, HBR, 1998)Research shows that a high level of emotional intelligence (EQ) is associated with better performance in areas such as self-awareness, decision-making and developing relationships with others. As a manager, you are expected to work with and through team members, peers and stakeholders to achieve results. When perspectives differ, emotions show up, impacting the people you work with as well as your own work performance. How aware are you of your emotions and their impact on your behaviour and others around you? How do you strengthen your impact, presence and interpersonal connections through the use of emotional intelligence?Specially designed for managers, this programme will help you leverage your emotional intelligence to be a more effective team leader.ObjectivesBy the end of this programme, you will be able to:Recognise the role of EQ in leadershipDevelop EQ behaviours and practices at work to better lead your officers through the understanding of EQ competencies, tools and knowledgeIncrease your emotional self-awareness and understandingAcquire skills to develop resilience and greater capacity for leadershipDevelop interpersonal competencies to understand, interact and relate well with others in an emotionally intelligent wayIdentify your current EQ strengths and areas of development based on the EQ-Assessment for Leaders (EQ-i 2.0) and relate the findings to your leadership context to enhance your effectiveness as a managerDevelop a personal action plan to enhance your leadership impact and presence
whoshouldattend: You are a first-time manager or equivalent with supervisory responsibilities.

course_name: Leading from the Middle Programme
overview: ‘Leading from the Middle’ is a 7-day programme (4 classroom days and 3 Action Learning Set sessions) that is fully dedicated to support the leadership development of middle managers in transition. At each transition, individuals face significant challenges which demand a shift in perspective and an expanded skill set. This programme offers premium leadership content conducted by experienced facilitators,  and seeks to support middle managers by providing a dedicated space for you to focus on your personal leadership development.OBJECTIVESBy the end of the programme, you will be able to :Gain an honest appraisal of your leadership strengths and development needs and recognise potential career-derailment hazardsUnderstand the impact of your individual leadership and interpersonal behaviours on your work group's and organisation’s effectiveness.Enhance your ability to give and receive constructive feedback, and to build high performing teams.Understand and evaluate the implications of your preferred leadership style for influencing and inspiring others.Facilitate teams through periods of changeLearn how to foster greater team effectivenessAdopt a systems-view on organisational issues, align team goals/interests with the larger system and establish collaborative relationships with others
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who recently took on a new middle management role and/or are managing multiple teams e.g. Senior Assistant Director, Deputy Director at MX10, Head of Department (MOE), or equivalent level. This programme is especially relevant for you if you are still within the first year of taking on your new management role. If you have not attended or been scheduled to attend CSC’s milestone programmes, it is highly recommended for you to attend this programme.

course_name: OD Practitioner Foundation Programme
overview: Organisation Development (OD) is an increasingly influential field of practice in the Singapore Public Service – one that is employed to support organisational transformation, manage complex change, and enhance organisational performance, while ensuring that employees stay engaged in the process.  If you have just joined the OD function and would like to learn more about how you as an OD practitioner can contribute to your organisation's health and effectiveness, this is the programme for you.In this updated version of the OD Practitioner Foundation Programme, you will gain an overview of the OD practice field, its history and how it has evolved in the Singapore Public Service. You will also undergo a unique, immersive experiential exercise and a proven methodology that enables you to make sense of the complexities of organisational behaviour and the actions you can take to make a significant impact. The programme also provides you with the opportunity to build valuable networks and friendships with fellow OD practitioners from various Public Service organisations.Objectives:By the end of the programme course you will:Gain an overview of the OD practice field, its history and how it has evolved in the Singapore Public ServiceDevelop insights on seeing organisations as systems, and some of the common and predictable challenges they faceAppreciate how OD practice can contribute towards organisational health and performanceGrow your network with the OD practitioner community in the Public Service
whoshouldattend: You are an OD practitioner who is interested to learn the definition and practices of OD, the OD cycle and the role of OD practitioners in organisations. This programme is also recommended for officers involved in the Public Service Transformation (PST), Organisational Excellence (OE) and organisational change.Note: This programme is a pre-requisite for the following OD practitioner programmes:Organisation Diagnosis Programme for OD Practitioners (DS101)OD Practitioner Certification Programme (ODC01)OD Practitioner Intermediate Programme (IPO10)

overview: As an OD practitioner, how can you better manage your presence in complex and uncertain times to be fully present and effectively serve the people and organisation you work with?OD practitioners are often expected to help navigate change. With change, tension arises and how you react to it affects your presence and effectiveness. Your impact as a practitioner will be hugely reduced if you are not fully present. Hence, learning how to project a calming presence can help to create the conditions to move the people and organisation forward during uncertain, complex and tense situations.ObjectivesBy the end of this programme, you will be able to:Understand how your inner self impacts your outer work and presenceManage your anxiety when working in complex and uncertain timesLearn a framework and language to manage tensionIdentify options to respond to tension to better serve the people and organisations you work with
