course_name: Leading WITs Successfully
overview: Since its inception in 1981, the Work Improvement Team Scheme (WITs) has contributed greatly to the Public Service through cost savings, waste reduction and Improved response time.  Against the current backdrop of global challenges, best sourcing and greater cross-agency collaborations, WITs continues play an important role as a key vehicle for public officers to exercise individual initiative, teamwork and leadership. At the same time, it also helps members cultivate a spirit of continuous learning.  Through this programme, you will acquire the leadership, project management and systems thinking skills needed by WITs leaders to successfully lead WITs teams.  Please note that this programme, Leading WITs Successfully (LWS13) , is developed for staff leading WITs teams and is different from the Facilitating WITs Effectively programme (FWE10), which is developed for heads of departments who facilitate WITs leaders' work.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Perform your role as a WITs LeadersUse WITs Advanced Tools and Techniques in team problem-solvingUse Transactional Analysis to communicate effectivelyExplain the Motivational Needs of team membersUse various strategies for Conflict ManagementVet WITs Project Reports and prepare WITs team for Presentations
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer with supervisory responsibilities. You may also be leading, or will lead, WITs Teams and Projects.

course_name: E-Government: Towards Public Sector Excellence
overview: As the world embraces information technology, governments cannot afford to lag behind. Because globalisation has made it possible for citizens to live abroad while staying connected with their home country, governments need to find ways to use technology to serve and engage their citizenry. This programme will provide you with the opportunity to learn firsthand how the Singapore government uses technology to administer public services more efficiently. related_programs.prog_name: Applied Change Management: Prosci® Change Management Certification Programme

course_name: Managing Change in the Singapore Public Service
overview: The global environment today is characterised by rapid and unrelenting change. In such an environment, the ability to adapt quickly and constantly will be a source of competitive advantage for businesses and nations. In Singapore, our survival depends on us developing the sharpest instincts for sensing changes in our operating environment and taking the necessary measures in time to deal with those changes. How have we fostered an environment which induces and welcomes continuous change? This programme will show you how the Singapore Public Service has spurred changes to keep pace with new times and how we have handled our change management process.  Objectives:By the end of this course, you will be able to:  Appreciate change processes in the Singapore Public ServiceDescribe best practices in the management of change and performance in the Public ServiceFormulate and facilitate organisational transitions through the use of proven frameworks and strategies to lead and champion changeDevelop and implement individual action plans for change in your organisations/countries

course_name: Human Resource Management and Development in the Singapore Public Service
overview: With human capital being a key resource of any government, it is important to deepen the capabilities of HR officers to enable them to become strategic partners who can add value to their organisation's performance. This programme will provide you with a better understanding of the Human Resource framework, policies, strategies and practices in the Singapore Public Service and the global best practices in HR management.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Identify the HR framework and policies applied in the Singapore Public ServiceIdentify key trends and developments affecting human resource managementFormulate strategic human resource plans to improve the management of human resources in your organisations
whoshouldattend: You are an HR professional. (This course will be customised according to the seniority of the participants.)

course_name: Training and Development Programme
overview: Teaching you the different training and development principles, concepts and strategies, this programme aims to equip you with critical foundational techniques and abilities in Training & Development (T&D). You will thus be well-equipped to conduct organisational performance analysis to identify performance gaps, recommend and implement appropriate training and/or non-training interventions, to help your organisation achieve its stated goals.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Understand the latest concepts and skills in Human Resource DevelopmentUtilise the key training and development tools and methodologiesUnderstand the training and development issues and the fundamentals of designing and delivering training programmes

course_name: Instructional Design and Delivery Techniques
overview: Keeping information fresh and reinforcing new learning is a constant challenge to a trainer. How do you choose activities that are fun, meaningful and engaging for the learners? How do you create a successful training session? This programme will equip you with the techniques to design, deliver and facilitate effective training to motivate and stimulate learning in your trainees. You will learn how to use different types of training strategies and ideas to create a better environment to engage your learners. You will soon be designing and conducting training that delivers impressive and measurable results for your learners and your organisation.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Conduct a Training Needs Analysis (TNA)Understand how people learnCreate a learning environmentKnow the importance and techniques of getting people involved

course_name: Finance Foundation Programme
overview: The Finance Foundation Programme is the first of a series of milestone programmes under the Finance Specialist Track launched by the Ministry of Finance.Aside from e-lectures, the programme includes a comprehensive five-day classroom learning segment to help you better understand your role in the public service. The segment also provides practical insights to the rationale for finance policies and funding evaluation. You can also create peer networks within the public finance community.Learning OutcomesExplain the government structure and public finance functionsDiscuss the significant driving forces impacting Singapore's financial position and fiscal policiesExplain the key principles and policies in the management of resourcesDescribe the duties, responsibilities, and roles of finance officer as a manager, steward and business partnerExplain the common terminologies used in public financeIdentify control guideliness and requirements to ensure the integrity of operations, financial and accounting practices
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer with less than one year of experience in the finance function. You may possess prior experience in finance from the private sector.Note: Public Officers who have more than one year of experience but are nominated by their supervisors may also be considered.

overview: The HR Foundation Programme (HRFP) is the first of a series of HR milestone programmes. It is a comprehensive six day course that serves as an introduction to HR in the Civil Service. This course will help you establish a common understanding of HR and gain a basic understanding of your operating environment.Broadly, the programme will cover topics such as HR principles and philosophy, Public Service values, HR structures and accountabilities in the Public Service, and engaging employees and line managers through strategic communications. The programme will also draw from three areas that are fundamental to HR work in the Public Service – Recruitment and Selection, Performance Management, and Learning and Development. These will help you appreciate effective delivery of HR services.Learning ObjectivesThe HRFP will enable you to:Appreciate your unique operating environment and the distinct HR philosophy and principles in the Public Service;Acquire key basic HR skills and knowledge to practise outcome-oriented and people-centric HR management;Engender a greater commitment to developing yourself for greater HR effectiveness and value-add to the Service; andBuild peer networks within the Public Service HR Community

overview: With the rapidly changing global and local environment, the Singapore Public Service needs to transform itself to keep up with these changes. HR plays a critical role in supporting and enabling Public Sector Transformation efforts. Under the dynamic Public Service’s operating environment, HR needs to play an active role part in developing a future-ready workforce, partnering Senior Management in building a strong organisation leadership and enhancing engagement with officers. HR Directors need to become more effective strategic business partners to support decision-making with their organisation leaders. They will also need to leverage on knowledge from the private sector to develop more effective HR strategies and plans.The HR Leadership Programme (HRLP) is a 8 day milestone programme that provides HR Directors with the current HR context and emerging priorities for the Public Service. HR Leaders will be able to better recognise their role as strategic driver and enabler of organisational transformation to make public organisations futureready.Learning ObjectivesRecognise emerging changes in the external landscape, their impact on the Public Service, and implications on the role of HR leadersHone skills to become a more effective strategic business partner to organisation leaders in decision makingExamine and leverage on private sector best practices to push for innovation in HR practicesReflect upon current HR practices and philosophy, and re-examine fundamental assumptions of HR in the Public ServiceBuild greater awareness of one’s personal leadership style and gaps, and adjust one’s practice of HR leadership to engage stakeholders effectivelyStrengthen whole-of-government HR perspectivesDeepen the network of peer support and inculcate a practice of connecting with other HR practitioners for both work and ongoing development.Attain IHRP Certification

overview: Human Resource (HR) in the Public Service is more dynamic than before. Changes in the operating environment, such as cuts in manpower growth, competition for talent, shifting demographics, changing workforce attitudes and rising public expectations, mean that the Singapore Public Service needs to transform and keep up. HR plays an important role in actualising these transformations.At the organisational level, you partner our management team to make your agencies future-ready by being the key driver and enabler of change. At the workplace, you motivate your colleagues and help them to manage change, train and develop them with the right knowledge, skills, mind-sets and instincts to respond to the public confidently. The Human Resource Managers Programme (HRMP) will provide you the perspectives, networks and knowledge to achieve these.Targeted at experienced HR middle management, this seven-day milestone programme will introduce you to strategic HR concepts. It will also equip you with the tools and knowledge on how you can support your HR leader, work with management and manage line departments effectively. In addition, you will have the opportunity to apply what you have learned through an individual project with a chosen topic of significance to you and your organisation. The project, titled HR Challenge, will enable you to tap on the wisdom and experience of an assigned HR Leader, and together with the support of your supervisor, work on the issue and source for feasible solutions to be implemented at your workplace. IHRP - Certified Professional assessment will also be included in the programme.

overview: Before you can start looking for meaningful patterns in data, you need to know how to collect and analyse data. Hence, to enhance the value of the analytics produced, you need a basic understanding of statistics at least.This e-Learning programme provides you with a solid foundation and understanding of analytics by helping you comprehend basic statistical concepts in a practical way. Within the course, you will also learn how some agencies present data in practical ways for everyday use.ObjectivesExplain the need to collect relevant dataAnalyse and interpret results reliably and confidentlyAssess suitable ways of presenting data
whoshouldattend: You are officer who, while not having a fundamental understanding of statistics, would want to gain a practical understanding of how to collect, analyse and present data at your workplace.

course_name: Getting Started with WITs (e-learning)
overview: The PS21 movement encourages every public officer to think creatively and to find ways to do their work better. WITS is one methodology to that can empower public officers to be more creative and effective in solving problems, to come up solutions that can make your jobs and work easier!In this programme, you will gain a good overview of WITS and how it relates to the PS21 movement along with the WITS processes and key WITS tools. A set of successful WITS cases will get you thinking about all the possible improvements and innovations in your work!ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Relate the PS21 movement and the WITS philosophy of WITsIllustrate the WITS process frameworkExplain the key activities in each stage of the PDCA cycleIdentify the appropriate WITS tools for each activity in the PDCA cycleRelate the application of WITS tools through a case illustrationMake use of creative learning tools to generate solutions to a problem
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer involved in your agency's WITs projects.

overview: After dedicating several decades to working, you look forward to finally being able to pursue your own interests as your retirement approaches. However, how enjoyable your retirement is depends very much on how sufficiently you have prepared for this milestone period of your life. You will learn how to address critical issues associated with retirement and plan for your retirement effectively.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Prepare for retirement with a general deeper awareness of the issues associated with retirementDeal with some of these issues in a more prepared manner
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who wants to find out how you can get the most out of your retirement period.

overview: The Public Service plays a key role in the lives of Singaporeans and the competitiveness of our economy. With its continual evolution, delivery of public services from the customer and citizen perspective need to be re-looked, keeping in mind to delight the public.  As one of the core courses developed under the Service Excellence Training Framework, you will understand the principles and values behind public service delivery. You will also be exposed to various examples and case studies on best practices in service performance.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Identify the key principles that guide your delivery of Public ServicesDistinguish between the IS and IS NOT of service excellence in the Public ServiceAdopt practices that support Public Service minimum service standards in your own area of workExplain the whole-of-government approach in solving citizens’ problemsAccept the importance of fostering the government philosophy of service and culture among staff
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who manages or supervises frontline officers.

course_name: No Wrong Door (e-learning)
overview: Imagine if you are a customer faced with an issue. You approach an agency and you are simply told that you have knocked on the wrong door as it is not under their purview. You are left on your own to search for the right agency. What kind of impression will you form on this agency and on the Public Service as a whole?  The “No Wrong Door” policy was introduced in 2004 as a means for the Public Service to deal with misdirected feedback or cross-agency issues from the public effectively.In July 2012 the NWD was enhanced with the First Responder Protocol (FRP), providing greater clarity for public officers in the operationalisation of the policy.You will be provided with an understanding of the policy through interactive case studies and real-life examples. You will also be involved in situation role-plays to practice the “No Wrong Door” policy and the First Responder Protocol, to prepare you to apply it back in your workplace.  ObjectivesBy the end of the course, you will be able to:Explain what the No Wrong Door (NWD) policy is and how it helps you to deliver customer-centric service to the public.Know what the First Responder Protocol (FRP) is, and activate it when issues are complex or requires inter-agency collaboration.Be familiar with the NWD and FRP escalation timelines as well as the corresponding desired outcomes.Locate resources and support when you encounter situations which require you to practise the NWD policy and the FRP.
opento: Support Officer; Senior Officer; Manager; Middle Management
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer whose work involves inter-agency coordination as you deliver service to the public.

course_name: Public Service Orientation Kit (e-learning)
overview: Spanning 15 Ministries and more than 50 Statutory Boards, the Public Service brings together many disparate organisations. Despite the common government denominator, you realise that its internal diversity is staggeringly multifaceted and trying to understand the Public Service all at one go is a daunting task. That is why this programme capitalises on an e-Learning platform to demystify the complexity of the Public Service and explain to you how it is set up and its core tenets – while keeping to a pace comfortable for you.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Gain a common sense of identity, values and pride as a Public Officer Identify the role of the Government and the Public ServiceExplain the basics of key Public Service systems

overview: Are you in a situation where the service team under you is not performing up to expectations? Do you find that your team’s motivation and customer satisfaction fluctuates and varies too frequently? Or do you think you have put in your best effort but change is beyond you? Worry not. course_name: 3Rs Module 1: Getting a Global Mindset
overview: Our global environment is ruled by much flux and uncertainty. Singapore has also evolved where we now have a better educated, more discerning and demanding citizenry. Indeed, the whole world has seen a series of unprecedented political, ethical, economic and financial issues.Module 1: Getting a Global Mindset will help you keep pace with the rapidly changing global environment and grasp the new challenges arising. With a new sense of awareness, you will recognise how the Public Service is shaped and affected by global forces and learn to adapt to them accordingly.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Develop a heightened awareness of global perspectives and look at public organisations and work in a global contextGrasp the arising challenges and threats in the rapidly changing global environment and their impact on Singapore and the Public ServiceLearn the important principles of public sector governance and develop a greater understanding of the strategic efforts of the Public Service towards meeting the global challengesDevelop skills that can be used to better adapt and deal with a global environment
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who supports your team, usually in administrative matters.

course_name: 3Rs Module 2: Finding Opportunities to Make a Difference
overview: Traditionally, we associate adding value with the ability to do our job more effectively by being technically competent or performing beyond expectations. This is no longer sufficient. Today, confronted by more challenging conditions, the Public Service demands more of you with regard to adding value, thus changing the context of your work.Module 2: Finding Opportunities to Make a Difference will help you identify opportunities to add value to your work meaningfully. This involves thinking differently, questioning basic assumptions, active listening, taking calculated risks and effective actions. You will learn to cut red tape to eliminate cumbersome and outdated practices, and expedite procedures without compromising organisational objectives.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Develop a willingness to try new things, act on new ideas and take calculated risksRecognise and confront personal barriers and behavioural patterns that limit the ability to take meaningful actions which add value to excellence at workApply effective approaches to eliminate cumbersome and outdated practices and expedite procedures
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who supports your team, usually in administrative matters.

course_name: 3Rs Module 3: Oops! More Value Add Qualities Needed
overview: Innovation, enterprise and risk-taking are critical to the Public Service to ensure Singapore's long term survival and growth. We need public officers with the capacity to be engaged, to be resilient, optimistic, tenaciously curious and to keep looking for creative solutions.  Module 3: Oops! More Value Add Qualities Needed will help you develop the qualities and mindset of a “value adder”. You will learn to strengthen your resilience to cope with difficulties at work, re-engage your curiosity, develop courage to manage challenging situations at work and at home, and strike a work-life balance to prevent burn-out.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Discover Oops!, an approach that brings about a more holistic and value-added outcome to a situation or problemApply Oops! Thinking, a value-added thinking skill to achieve greater empowerment in a changing workplaceStrengthen resilience, an important value-added coping skill to face difficulties at the workplace and at homeDevelop courage, another value-added factor to take on new situational challenges at the workplaceLearn to balance between work and home to prevent burn-out
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who supports your team, usually in administrative matters.

course_name: 3Rs Module 4: Thriving and Communicating in the Changing Workplace
overview: A key phenomenon in the Public Service is a new generation of officers assuming higher responsibilities and managing older and more experienced staff. Public officers also find themselves confronted with new priorities presented by new strategic initiatives. The new leadership, different work styles and expectations have implications for the working relationship between supervisor-supervisee and among peers.  Module 4: Thriving and Communicating in the Changing Workplace, will help you grasp how the workplace is changing and shaped by a different generation of public officers and new priorities, and the implications for personal strategies of control. You will learn to develop effective behaviours to become more adaptable and to work effectively with supervisors and colleagues in a more demanding environment.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Be aware of the recent changes that have occurred at the workplaceAppreciate the attributes and value of the different workforce generationsDevelop rapport with and respect for your supervisors and colleaguesHandle potential work-style conflicts
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who supports your team, usually in administrative matters.

course_name: Internal Customer Service - Improving Internal Relations For Service Delivery
overview: Every employee in an organisation plays a significant role in customer service. Even though you may not have direct contact with an external customer, your behaviour will ultimately impact fellow colleagues who regularly deal with members of the public.  You will explore the concept of an ‘internal customer’ and learn how treating internal departments as customers significantly lead to greater efficiency and better service to external customers.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Understand what is meant by internal customer care and recognise how it can benefit you as an individual and as a member of an organisation-wide teamDevelop an understanding of the attitude and skills required to effect successful internal customer serviceAccept the need to use your organisation’s standards and procedures responsiblyIdentify improvements to working procedures to help colleagues service external customersImprove workplace communication skills for internal customer care
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who is in a role that supports other departments and functions within the organisation.Note: This course is best done in-house with colleagues from different departments.

course_name: A Systemic Approach to Managing and Implementing Service Excellence
overview: Compared to the past, service quality has improved significantly in the public sector. The constant challenge is to maintain this quality yet come up with new initiatives to push for service excellence. Knowing our customer profile and managing customer expectations are valuable tools for advancing towards the goal of total organisational excellence.At a strategic level, you will look at ways to drive service quality from designing approaches to developing a customer-centric organisation and optimising the service delivery process. You will also learn what service excellence means, what it takes to drive service quality, the characteristics of a service quality leader, and distinctive aspects of service management.As a new addition to this course, you will get to learn :Design thinking in service processMystery customer audits (live practice session)Case study: Service transformation of Wildlife Reserves SingaporeObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Acquire a customer-focused mindsetAppreciate the critical facets of your leadership roleAcquire a framework to drive service quality implementationAcquire tools to optimise the service delivery process
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who is involved in implementing service quality, driving service initiatives in your agency. You could also be involved in re-engineering existing processes to be more customer focused.

course_name: SQ Role Model - Exemplifying Excellence In Customer Service
overview: MAGIC, also known as ‘Make A Great Impression on the Customer’, sets a benchmark for public officers to follow in order to shape our citizens’ impression of service and build an image and reputation of a first-class public service.  MAGIC creates positive interactions with customers and manages perceptions. You must first make the choice to practice ‘MAGIC’, thereby sharpening your actions and strategies to interact with your customers more effectively. As a result, your organisation, customers and most of all, you, will benefit. You will learn the importance of relationships, and how to build self-awareness, so that you will present your personal best at all times. You will also gain skills which are necessary to interact effectively with others and be empowered to be ‘MAGIC’.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Develop a commitment to exemplify service quality and champion customer serviceDeliver a customer experience that meets and exceeds customers’ expectations and objectivesCommunicate with the customer in mind, using customer service techniques at each stage of a customer interaction to build MAGIC relationships
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who motivates and leads a service team.

course_name: The Art Of Service Recovery For Senior Officers
overview: Even the most service-oriented organisation stumbles occasionally. At times like these, you and your organisation need to act swiftly and be proactive to solve the problem and regain the customer's trust.  You will learn the art of service recovery and how organisations can turn problems into opportunities by designing systems that respond immediately to correct product and service errors. You will also be shown how service recovery can create the type of customer satisfaction that pays off in the long run.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Establish the rationale for service recoveryAcquire tips for effective recovery at the service encounter levelUnderstand the organisational framework and process for effective service recoveryAccept the need for empowerment and identify ways in which staff can be empowered to deliver effective recoveryUnderstand the concept of service reliability through service system design
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer dealing with external customers. You are either managing the service delivery process or delivering service

course_name: Becoming A Service Superstar - Bringing Out The Service Champion In You
in-houseinformation: This programme can be conducted as an in-house session if your agency is able to meet the required class size of 20 to 25.Please click here for more information.
overview: How can you as a public officer make a difference to the citizens and customers you serve? Through this course, you will be a star performer within the organisation, one who creates enchanting service encounters and demonstrates service behaviours that delight customers. You will also develop the service mindset and attributes that impact superior customer satisfaction. Come and find out how you can take ownership for a charming customer experience, seek out service opportunity, exercise empowerment and become truly, a Service Champion.  ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Identify service attributes that set frontline staff apart as shining examples of service professionalsRecognise the importance of seeking out service opportunities and demonstrate customer-focused behaviourExercise self-empowering strategies and apply creative problem-solving techniquesAppreciate your roles as a service ambassador and commit to developing a “Customer first” mindset
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer dealing with external customers. You are either managing the service delivery process or delivering service.

course_name: Winning Over Difficult Customers In The Public Sector - Defusing Their Hostility
overview: Regardless of their role, public officers who deal with customers face the challenge of managing frustrated customers on a daily basis. These frustrated customers can turn out to be verbally abusive or hostile, which is often due to misunderstandings surrounding the situation.Fortunately, there are various skills which can assist you to take control of the situation and defuse angry customers. You will learn new methods to get to the heart of the problem. There are few things more satisfying than successfully dealing with an angry customer to achieve a mutually satisfying result for both your customer and your organisation. You will be shown ways to keep a friendly yet professional attitude; display genuine interest and concern, calm the customer, acknowledge the situation, listen empathetically, focus on the problem, get specific details and solve it.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Apply defusing principles to guide your actions and develop skills for defusing hostilityUse strategies and tactics to gain control over hostile interactions and counter customers’ attempt to intimidate youCreate a cooperative climate when faced with angry customers, through the use of cooperative language and techniques to acknowledge their feelingsDiscuss what supervisors can do to support referral and effective defusing
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer dealing with external customers. You are either managing the service delivery process or delivering service excellence.

course_name: Supervising & Coaching Staff for Service Excellence
overview: As a manager or supervisor in a service-oriented environment, you play an important role in ensuring that your staff are properly managed and developed to achieve organisational goals. A leader who has the skills to be an effective coach and manager has proven to increase team members’ level of confidence, motivation and morale, which will in turn lead to better team performance.Within your team, you will examine your role as a service pacesetter. You will learn to lead change and manage your staff. At an organisational level, you will uniformly implement service standards and practices to achieve service excellence.In this course, you will learn what your key roles and responsibilities are as a supervisor or manager. Also, you will be introduced to coaching techniques to improve team members’ performance in service delivery. Finally, the segment on performance assessment will focus on equipping you with the skills to identify and analyse gaps in your officers’ performance, as well as identify training needs and interventions to help them address these gaps.Course ObjectivesAt the end of the course, you will be able to:Explain to staff how the CARE + 3 service principles in the public sector are applied in a face-to-face and telephone service interaction with members of the publicExplain the 4R process in interactions with customers and the service standards expectedExplain to staff the concept of Moment Of Truth (MOT) and what can be done by the organisation or the staff to create positive MOTs for their customersIdentify your roles as managers and supervisors in developing the staff towards service excellenceApply the skills to inspire, develop and assess frontline and telephone service staff
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer who is responsible for the quality of service delivered by your team or department.

course_name: Winning Over Difficult Customers In The Public Sector - Defusing Their Hostility
overview: Regardless of their role, public officers who deal with customers face the challenge of managing frustrated customers on a daily basis. These frustrated customers can turn out to be verbally abusive or hostile, which is often due to misunderstandings surrounding the situation.Fortunately, there are various skills which can assist you to take control of the situation and defuse angry customers. You will learn new methods to get to the heart of the problem. There are few things more satisfying than successfully dealing with an angry customer to achieve a mutually satisfying result for both your customer and your organisation. You will be shown ways to keep a friendly yet professional attitude; display genuine interest and concern, calm the customer, acknowledge the situation, listen empathetically, focus on the problem, get specific details and solve it.ObjectivesBy the end of this course, you will be able to:Apply defusing principles to guide your actions and develop skills for defusing hostilityUse strategies and tactics to gain control over hostile interactions and counter customers’ attempt to intimidate youCreate a cooperative climate when faced with angry customers, through the use of cooperative language and techniques to acknowledge their feelingsDiscuss what supervisors can do to support referral and effective defusing
whoshouldattend: You are a Singapore Public Officer dealing with external customers. You are either managing the service delivery process or delivering service excellence.
